greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Infinite sequence of signed integers where each is chosen to be as small as possible (in absolute value) subject to the condition that for every k >= 1, all the k(k+1)/2 numbers in the triangle of differences of the first k terms are distinct; in case of a tie, preference is given to the positive value.
comment: This sequence is a signed variant of A327460.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
Rémy Sigrist, C# program for A327887
formula: Apparently, abs(a(n)) ~ n as n tends to infinity.
example: The difference table for the first 8 terms is:
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Sep 29 2019
